article.headline: Davidson 68, Elon University 61
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Ian Johnson scored 15 points, including seven during a late 18-4 run, and Davidson beat Elon 68-61 to reach the Southern Conference tournament semifinals Thursday. The Wildcats (17-11) go against defending tournament champ, East Tennessee State, for a shot at the SoCon title -- and the automatic NCAA tournament bid that goes with it. For a while, though, it looked like Davidson might get tripped up by Elon (12-18), playing their first Southern Conference tournament. Jackson Atoyebi had a three-point play and Gary Marsh a short jumper to put the Phoenix ahead 53-47 with 5:26 remaining. But Johnson got the winning run started with a basket, then Logan Kosmalski had a 3-pointer and a three-point play, and Johnson another jumper. The coach's son, Matt McKillop, added a 3-pointer and two foul shots before Johnson closed the run with his own 3-pointer to put Davidson ahead 65-57. Johnson made seven of 11 shots from the floor before fouling out in the final two minutes. It's the third time in the past four years the Wildcats have gotten to the tournament's semifinals. Kosmalski had 13 points, all in the second half, for Davidson. Elon was led by Atoyebi, who had 20 points and 10 rebounds.
